intro: Schiedea stellarioides var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved star-moss, is a succulent plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy, dark green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces vibrant pink or red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
